Verse: "And a second is like it: You shall love your neighbor as yourself."
A dishonest man spreads strife, and a whisperer separates close friends.
A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
A glad heart makes a cheerful face, but by sorrow of heart the spirit is crushed.
A hot-tempered man stirs up strife, but he who is slow to anger quiets contention.
A joyful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another: just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another. By this all people will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.
A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.
And after you have suffered a little while, the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.
And he said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. This is the great and first commandment.
And hope does not put us to shame, because God's love has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who has been given to us.
And I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them in your name, which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are one.
And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ.
And I shall walk in a wide place, for I have sought your precepts.
And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
And the King will answer them, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
And this is eternal life, that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom you have sent.
And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.
Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down, but a good word makes him glad.
As in water face reflects face, so the heart of man reflects the man.
Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him; fret not yourself over the one who prospers in his way, because of the man who carries out evil devices!
Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD!
Because your steadfast love is better than life, my lips will praise you.
Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I keep your word.
Behold, the eye of the LORD is on those who fear him, on those who hope in his steadfast love.
Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God.
Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues with injustice.
Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits, who forgives all your iniquity, who heals all your diseases.
Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse them.
Blessed are the merciful, for they shall receive mercy.
Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.
Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.
Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.
Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

Blessed are you when others revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account. Rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort, who comforts us in all our affliction, so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.' Therefore I will boast all the more gladly of my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
But I call to God, and the LORD will save me. Evening and morning and at noon I pray and cry aloud, and he hears my voice.
But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.
But I trust in you, O LORD; I say, “You are my God.” My times are in your hand; rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors!
But in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect.
But Jesus looked at them and said, 'With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.'
But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.
But they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.
But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God.
But when the Helper comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will bear witness about me.
But when you pray, go into your room and shut the door and pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
But you, O LORD, are a shield about me, my glory, and the lifter of my head.
Cast your burden on the LORD, and he will sustain you; he will never permit the righteous to be moved.
Casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
Come, O children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
Commit your way to the LORD; trust in him, and he will act.
Commit your work to the LORD, and your plans will be established.
Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness.
Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and those who love it will eat its fruits.
Delight yourself in the LORD, and he will give you the desires of your heart.

Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal, but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.
Do not repay evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary, bless, for to this you were called, that you may obtain a blessing.
Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. Let each of you look not only to his own interests, but also to the interests of others.
Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.
Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree bad and its fruit bad, for the tree is known by its fruit.
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
Everyone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.
Fear not, for I am with you; be not dismayed, for I am your God; I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might.

Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, think about these things.
For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast.
For God alone my soul waits in silence; from him comes my salvation. He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress; I shall not be greatly shaken.
For God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
For his anger is but for a moment, and his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night, but joy comes with the morning.

For I am sure that neither death nor life, nor angels nor rulers, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers, nor height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord.
For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worth comparing with the glory that is to be revealed to us.
For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you, but if you do not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, declares the LORD. For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
For the LORD gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
For the righteous falls seven times and rises again, but the wicked stumble in times of calamity.
For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
For those whom he foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, in order that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.
For we walk by faith, not by sight.
For where two or three are gathered in my name, there am I among them.
For you are my rock and my fortress; and for your name’s sake you lead me and guide me.
For you did not receive the spirit of slavery to fall back into fear, but you have received the Spirit of adoption as sons, by whom we cry, “Abba! Father!”
Forever, O LORD, your word is firmly fixed in the heavens.
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Good sense is a fountain of life to him who has it, but the instruction of fools is folly.
Good sense makes one slow to anger, and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
Gracious words are like a honeycomb, sweetness to the soul and health to the body.
Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is gained in a righteous life.
Great peace have those who love your law; nothing can make them stumble.
Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all offenses.
Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.
He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time, “Do you love me?” and he said to him, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.
He who did not spare his own Son but gave him up for us all, how will he not also with him graciously give us all things?
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will abide in the shadow of the Almighty. I will say to the LORD, 'My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'
Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your produce; then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will burst with wine.
Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to your word.
How much better to get wisdom than gold! To get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God so that at the proper time he may exalt you.
I am the vine; you are the branches. Whoever abides in me and I in him, he it is that bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
I appeal to you therefore, brothers, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your spiritual worship.
I can do all things through him who strengthens me.

I do not ask for these only, but also for those who will believe in me through their word, that they may all be one, just as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be in us, so that the world may believe that you have sent me.
I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I set your rules before me.
I have said these things to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.
I have set the LORD always before me; because he is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken.
I have stored up your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.
I lift up my eyes to the hills. From where does my help come? My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.
I praise you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Wonderful are your works; my soul knows it very well.
I sought the LORD, and he answered me and delivered me from all my fears.
I wait for the LORD, my soul waits, and in his word I hope.
I waited patiently for the LORD; he inclined to me and heard my cry. He drew me up from the pit of destruction, out of the miry bog, and set my feet upon a rock, making my steps secure.
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my eye upon you.
I will meditate on your precepts and fix my eyes on your ways.
I will never forget your precepts, for by them you have given me life.
If the world hates you, know that it has hated me before it hated you.
If you abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
If you love me, you will keep my commandments.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father who is in heaven.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father who is in heaven.
It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor than to divide the spoil with the proud.
It is good for me that I was afflicted, that I might learn your statutes.
Jesus answered him, 'Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.'
Jesus answered him, “If anyone loves me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
Jesus said to her, 'I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die. Do you believe this?'
Jesus said to him, 'I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
Keep steady my steps according to your promise, and let no iniquity get dominion over me.
Keep your heart with all vigilance, for from it flow the springs of life.
Lead me in your truth and teach me, for you are the God of my salvation; for you I wait all the day long.
Let all that you do be done in love.
Let love be genuine. Abhor what is evil; hold fast to what is good.
Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
Let not steadfast love and faithfulness forsake you; bind them around your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart. So you will find favor and good success in the sight of God and man.
Let not your hearts be troubled. Believe in God; believe also in me.
Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, establish the work of our hands!
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in your sight, O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
Let your steadfast love comfort me according to your promise to your servant.
Likewise the Spirit helps us in our weakness. For we do not know what to pray for as we ought, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with groanings too deep for words.
Look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, making the best use of the time, because the days are evil.
Love does no wrong to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfilling of the law.

Love is patient and kind; love does not envy or boast; it is not arrogant or rude. It does not insist on its own way; it is not irritable or resentful; it does not rejoice at wrongdoing, but rejoices with the truth. Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
Love the LORD, all you his saints! The LORD preserves the faithful but abundantly repays the one who acts in pride.
Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the LORD delivers him out of them all.
Many are the plans in the mind of a man, but it is the purpose of the LORD that will stand.

May the God of endurance and encouragement grant you to live in such harmony with one another, in accord with Christ Jesus, that together you may with one voice glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that by the power of the Holy Spirit you may abound in hope.
My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
My son, do not despise the LORD’s discipline or be weary of his reproof, for the LORD reproves him whom he loves, as a father the son in whom he delights.
My soul melts away for sorrow; strengthen me according to your word!
No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.

No temptation has overtaken you that is not common to man. God is faithful, and he will not let you be tempted beyond your ability, but with the temptation he will also provide the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.
No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.
Not only that, but we rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering produces endurance, and endurance produces character, and character produces hope.
Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
Now to him who is able to do far more abundantly than all that we ask or think, according to the power at work within us.
Oh how I love your law! It is my meditation all the day.
Oh, how abundant is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you and worked for those who take refuge in you, in the sight of the sons of mankind!
Oh, taste and see that the LORD is good! Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him!
Open my eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of your law.
Owe no one anything, except to love each other, for the one who loves another has fulfilled the law.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid.
Praying at all times in the Spirit, with all prayer and supplication. To that end, keep alert with all perseverance, making supplication for all the saints.
Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil.
Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
Rejoice in hope, be patient in tribulation, be constant in prayer.
Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep.
Remember the wondrous works that he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he uttered.
Repay no one evil for evil, but give thought to do what is honorable in the sight of all. If possible, so far as it depends on you, live peaceably with all.
Righteous lips are the delight of a king, and he loves him who speaks what is right.
Sanctify them in the truth; your word is truth.
So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.
So then let us pursue what makes for peace and for mutual upbuilding.
So whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laughs at the time to come.
Surely there is a future, and your hope will not be cut off.
Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

That according to the riches of his glory he may grant you to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in your inner being, so that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith—that you, being rooted and grounded in love,
The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.
The crucible is for silver, and the furnace is for gold, and the LORD tests hearts.
The ear that listens to life-giving reproof will dwell among the wise.
The eyes of the LORD are toward the righteous and his ears toward their cry.
The fear of the LORD is instruction in wisdom, and humility comes before honor.
The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
The heart of man plans his way, but the LORD establishes his steps.
The heart of man plans his way, but the LORD establishes his steps.
The LORD is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
The LORD is good to all, and his mercy is over all that he has made.
The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
The LORD is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.
The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
The LORD is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
The LORD is near to the brokenhearted and saves the crushed in spirit.
The LORD will fulfill his purpose for me; your steadfast love, O LORD, endures forever. Do not forsake the work of your hands.
The name of the LORD is a strong tower; the righteous man runs into it and is safe.
The reward for humility and fear of the LORD is riches and honor and life.
The righteous who walks in his integrity— blessed are his children after him!
The sum of your word is truth, and every one of your righteous rules endures forever.
The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
The unfolding of your words gives light; it imparts understanding to the simple.
The wisest of women builds her house, but folly with her own hands tears it down.
Then Jesus told his disciples, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.'
There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
Therefore be imitators of God, as beloved children. And walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God.
Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.
Therefore welcome one another as Christ has welcomed you, for the glory of God.
These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be full.
This is my comfort in my affliction, that your promise gives me life.
This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
This is the day that the LORD has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.

Though you have not seen him, you love him. Though you do not now see him, you believe in him and rejoice with joy that is inexpressible and filled with glory, obtaining the outcome of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
To make an apt answer is a joy to a man, and a word in season, how good it is!
Train up a child in the way he should go; even when he is old he will not depart from it.
Trouble and anguish have found me out, but your commandments are my delight.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.
Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things; and give me life in your ways.
Until now you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.
Verse
Wait for the LORD; be strong, and let your heart take courage; wait for the LORD!
What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.
When a man's ways please the LORD, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
When I think on my ways, I turn my feet to your testimonies.
When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with the humble is wisdom.
When the cares of my heart are many, your consolations cheer my soul.
When the righteous cry for help, the LORD hears and delivers them out of all their troubles.

When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all the truth, for he will not speak on his own authority, but whatever he hears he will speak, and he will declare to you the things that are to come.
Whoever brings blessing will be enriched, and one who waters will himself be watered.
Whoever gives thought to the word will discover good, and blessed is he who trusts in the LORD.
Whoever is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a hasty temper exalts folly.
Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
Whoever pursues righteousness and kindness will find life, righteousness, and honor.
Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.
With all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love, eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
Without counsel plans fail, but with many advisers they succeed.
You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.
You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.
You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit and that your fruit should abide, so that whatever you ask the Father in my name, he may give it to you.
You keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on you, because he trusts in you.
Your hands have made and fashioned me; give me understanding that I may learn your commandments.
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
